author: Jeff
title: Movie theater chain adds playgrounds (10 Photos)
text:
1 
One movie theater chain is taking a $500,000 approach to improving their theaters with kids in mind. 2 
Cinepolis, a theater chain with locations mostly in Mexico (but with over a dozen stateside) is opening up their first two “Cinepolis Junior” theaters. The Junior theaters are filled with entertainment options for kids to take part in like the jungle gym pictured here. 
The first two of the $500,000 theater playgrounds are opening next week with showings of the live action Beauty and the Beast . 3 
The theater features more “fun” seating options as well for the intended audience of children ages 3-12 years old, such as bean bag two-seaters and reclining cabana chairs. 4 
It also has playground equipment, slides, and decor to match the sensibility. Advertisement Advertisement 6 
To be fair to the chain, the theater only allows kids to play before the movie begins, and for 15 minutes after the movie ends. Not during the movie itself. 7 GIF 
Of course not everyone is as easy going about it. The online reaction to the theater was turned swiftly. 8 
If you stop and think about it, they are not the dramatic end of the theater going world catastrophe one might imagined. For parents, it seems like a pretty good way to make the movies more entertaining for young children 9 
It costs about $3 more per ticket and there are plenty of theaters in every multiplex for adult going audiences to enjoy playground free. 10 
The first two Cinepolis Junior theaters open next week in California.
